metadata.synopsis: Kelley Morse (Chris Klein), who is cocky and brash, normally would never have crossed paths with the residents of a small town near his posh private school. But when he races his new car against a local boy and destroys a diner, he is sentenced to rebuild the diner and falls in love with the owner's daughter (Leelee Sobieski).

reviews: Contrived plot purposely pulls at heartstrings.

This is just the type of "dignified" tragedy Louis B. Mayer loved to churn out in the 1940s, where characters - even the unsavory ones - acted so noble they practically turned to statues before your eyes.
Demonstrates the lowest, most unscrupulous technique of filmmaking -- it involves no imagination, creativity, or original ideas.
Here on Earth is a missed opportunity.
Here on Earth plods along predictably, hammering home its moral points and struggling to spin a spiritual haze around the kids' romance.
La direccin del filme cae ms dentro de los parmetros de una miniserie o pelcula hecha expresamente para la televisin que para la pantalla grande
Dramatically, the tragedy couldn't possibly be flatter.
Here on Earth does what it can to flatten the ascending careers of its attractive leads, yet Chris Klein and Leelee Sobieski probably will live to see another big-screen day.
The title is Here, but the plot is unfortunately all over the place.
Such a mawkish and poorly constructed piece of melodrama.
Even a casting flip-flop couldn't have saved Here on Earth's predictable premise, detestable dialogue or incongruous characters.
